page.title: 16Davenham Day Centre
page.content: The health and care of the elderly is the concern of the Social Services who administer the Day Centre. It is only old people that go there and many of them have a handicap. Mr Insley the Manager of the Centre has the help of 2 cooks, 1 domestic, a hairdresser, chiropodist, handycraft and 4 care assistants. Nobody sleeps there but the old people are collected and taken home by either a minibus or a taxi or a taxi-lift ambulance. They have 27 rooms. Recreation includes snooker, darts, table tennis, bingo, shuffle board and dominoes plus quizzes. They paint, read and write, they are helped with bathing, exercises and they have their meals packed or made for them, dinner is 90p and tea is 70p. About 40 people go there a day and about 130 go there a week.
